H0.text: Winds weakened was the most likely change that occurred when Juan noticed that sunny skies suddenly became stormy.

H1.text: Humidity decreased is the most likely event that occurred when Juan noticed that sunny skies suddenly became stormy.

H2.text: Air pressure dropped when Juan noticed the sunny skies suddenly became stormy.

H3.text: Temperatures increased when Juan noticed sunny skies suddenly become stormy.

A4.text: The lowest non-tornadic atmospheric pressure ever measured was 870 hPa, set on 12 October 1979, during Typhoon Tip in the western Pacific Ocean.
